alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 11:52AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following counties, Fairfield and New Haven. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1152 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain had fallen this morning, with several area small rivers and streams still rising. - Rainfall rates of up to an inch per hour possible with more rainfall moving in. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area through 3pm. This additional rain will result in or continue minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stamford, Waterbury, Danbury, Milford, Shelton, Naugatuck, Southbury, New Canaan, Wolcott, Sherman, Newtown, Fairfield, Trumbull, Cheshire, Ridgefield, Monroe, Bethel, Wilton, Seymour and Brookfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please heed any road closures. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
